intro: Passovia cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf pellitory, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are heart-shaped, hence the species name "cordata," and are often used in traditional medicine. Passovia cordata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
